title: Global stock markets fall as fears grow around China's economic slowdown
text:
Stock markets opened lower in Europe after further signals overnight of a marked slowdown in the Chinese economy which has been the engine of global growth.

In London the FTSE 100 dropped 0.3 per cent ahead of UK unemployment figures to be released this morning. Bourses in France and Germany also opened lower.

Meanwhile, the UK chancellor, Sajid Javid, attempted to sweeten the Brexit pill by promising to re-introduce duty-free cigarettes and alcohol if the UK leaves the EU without a deal on 31 October.
